intro: Minuartia mutabilis subsp. numidica, commonly known as the Mediterranean sand-verbena, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the Mediterranean region. It features small, typically pink or white flowers that bloom in the spring and summer. The plant has a mat-forming growth habit with thin, fleshy leaves adapted to arid conditions. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Its ability to tolerate drought makes it a resilient species in Mediterranean climates.
